organization.fullName: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

identificationModule.briefTitle: Early Antiplatelet for Minor Stroke Following Thrombolysis (EAST)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Early Antiplatelet for Minor Stroke Following Thrombolysis (EAST): a Prospective, Random, Double Blinded and Multi-center Study

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

leadSponsor.name: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The current guideline recommends to give antithrombotic treatment 24 hours after intravenous thrombolysis in acute ischemic stroke. However, early neurological deterioration will occur in some patients due to no antithrombotic treatment, which is closely associated with poor outcome. The current trial aims to investigate the effectiveness and safety of early antithrombotic treatment after intravenous thrombolysis in minor stroke.

interventions.name: Aspirin 100mg; Clopidogrel 300mg
interventions.description: Aspirin 100mg plus Clopidogrel 300mg will be orally administrated after randomization

primaryOutcomes.description: excellent prognosis is defined as modified Rankin Score (mRS) 0-1. The minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher score mean a worse outcome

secondaryOutcomes.description: Favorable prognosis is defined as modified Rankin Score (mRS) 0-2. The minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher score mean a worse outcome.
The minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher score mean a worse outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: the minimum and maximum values of NIHSS are 0 and 42, respectively; higher NIHSS mean a worse outcome.
END is defined as more than 2 point increase, but not result of cerebral hemorrhage, compared with baseline at 24 hours

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The incidence of symptomatic intracerebral hemorrhage
secondaryOutcomes.description: any evidence of bleeding on the head CT scan associated with clinically significant neurological deterioration (NIHSS score ≥4 points increase)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The incidence of any intracerebral hemorrhage
secondaryOutcomes.description: the evidence of bleeding on the head CT or MRI scan

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The incidence of stroke recurrence and other vascular events
The death due to any cause

locations.facility: Department of Neurology, General Hospital of Northern Theater Command
